t: Why Amazon’s Attrition is Higher than Attrition at Other Tech Companies | by Nick Dimitrov | Medium
s: October 29, 2020 - The average tenure of a full-time Amazonian is roughly one year, while tenure at other tech places like Facebook, Apple, and Google tends to be roughly about two years. Why is that? Before venturing…

3 days ago - Amazon opened its tenth physical bookstore in 2017; media speculation at the time suggested that Amazon planned to eventually roll out 300 to 400 bookstores around the country. All of its locations were closed in 2022 along with other retail locations under the "Amazon 4-Star" brand.

t: r/AmazonFC on Reddit: What is the average tenure of a Tier one amazon associate?
s: March 20, 2022 - In UK very few gets sacked, but most people quit fairly quickly. In some older sites average tenure is 7-10 years. ... Depending on the situation less than 3 months. Mostly because people tend to quit early or just use Amazon as a stepping stone to keep a steady work history.

t: Why do employees usually work for 2-3 years at Amazon Inc. and leave? - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 5): I think 2–3 years is like the industry average if in Tech. I’m answering assuming you are in tech. Most tech companies have a one year cliff in terms of stock compensation and in Amazon’s case often a signing bonus that also cliffs at one year.
